channel.title: Doom IV
channel.description:
Just some discussion and speculation. It was supposed to be unveiled at Quake con this year, but did not have a presentation ready.
[url]https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doom_4[/url]
bscly.
If what I hear is true, then the game has no choice but to be fucking awesome. I hope the rendition of the creatures actually look like they should.
Like updated and less cheesy versions of the old Doom I/II demons.
I just hope there's color.

item.title: Doom IV
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
xalener:

Cacodemon was just a huge clusterfuck visually.

Which is better than the original Doom, in which the entire game was a huge clusterfuck visually.

item.title: Doom IV
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Doom had a feel and look that Doom III broke is all.

That’s the main reason I don’t like DIII much. Other than the storyline and name, there was NO indicator that it was part of the same IP.

Hornless Imp is a dickless imp.
Lost soul with skin is no soul at all.
Cacodemon was just a huge clusterfuck visually.
Hellkight was cool admittedly.

Read full topic

i mainly hope it will be more like doom I/II and it will support open gl 4.0/dx11!

item.title: Doom IV
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

I’m going to just gonna say this. I feel like Doom 3 gets way worse a reputation than it deserves. Sure when you compare it to the original it has lots of faults but in that area it was stuck between a rock and a hard place. What was it going to do rehash the old overly simple run and gun game play? People would have bitched about that “Oh this game is so dated and its just lazy”. I think Doom 3 was a good attempt at trying to redirect the series for modern game design, it just turned out its not the direction fans wanted.

Doom 3 as its own game is fine other than the stupid ass flashlight thing.

Actually, despite it being a horror game, I don’t think it was as much a new direction as people think. Yes, it has way slower paced moments, but when it comes down to it, the combat is extremely similar to doom 1/2. Many of the situations encourage you to run and gun, and it feels very much like the old games.

In fact i do recall a lot of reviews criticized the game for its “dated” gameplay. I used to be one of the people who absolutely despised doom 3, but after playing the game through again in Coop, I started to see how similar to the old ones It actually was. It may not have been similar in looks, but certainly in feel.

Oh and the flashlight was piss poor.

Read full topic

item.title: Doom IV
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
I will say that the devs were smart with Doom 3. They realized that Doom is outdated and simplistic, and tried to innovate, and as far as I’m concerned, made a far better product than the original. Which is not to say I loved Doom 3, but it was okay.

Read full topic

item.title: Doom IV
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
TheeGoatPig:

I loved the Doom 3 cacodemons. They were awesome!

I have to disagree with you there, I felt like the Doom 3 caco looked too similar to the duke nukem 3d Octabrain:

They don’t have the exact same shape, but they share a similar color palette and the fact that the D3 caco has a brain showing and something hanging down from its main body makes me think ID took some “inspiration” from 3DR.

I thought the revenants and the mancubuses were pretty faithful though. The pinkies, I kind of liked but i feel like they should have been a different monster (maybe a higher tier pinky) because they differed too much.

Also, a bit off topic but anyone seen this?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bP5loqC6q3s

Read full topic

item.title: Doom IV
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
I loved the Doom 3 cacodemons. They were awesome!

I have to agree with you on the pinkies though. Not what they should have been. Though when I think back on it, I only took exception to the mechanical legs. I didn’t mind the rest of them.

I didn’t mind the Imps either. They were a nice redesign.

the Mancubuses were awesome in Doom 3 as well. Totally awesome…

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Doom IV
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
RKORTON:

I want to thank the creator of the forum. you got me so far that I’m installing doom 3 again xD

Thanks Hubi, for making it possible for this guy to be inspired to install Doom 3!

Someonerandm:

I’ve never liked Doom that much (as I believe I have expressed), but if it adds some depth to the shallow and dull kill everything on screen gameplay, it could be some good fun, but I have no real idea, since almost nothing is known. I would like a cyberdemon boss fight that isn’t just damage grinding.

Sounds like you might enjoy Doom 3.

Read full topic

item.title: Doom IV
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Someonerandm:

Yeah, but I prefer the gray area in which you speculate on the few details given and make wild hypotheses about what it all means.

So we know doom IV’s on earth and that it’s supposed to return to it’s roots. It’s supposed to look better than the already amazing looking Rage.

aaaand there doesn’t seem to be any indicator that it’s being developed by some other team with ID only producing (as with doom III/ Quake IV)

So it may actually be good.

Here’s hoping for secret areas.

Read full topic

item.title: Doom IV
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
Katana:

Speaking of Doom 3, who has played this?
https://www.thedarkmod.com/

The Dark Mod is probably the best mod I’ve ever downloaded. Thief is my favorite game and they captured it perfectly. I’ve put waaaaay more hours into dark mod fms than Doom 3 proper, that’s for sure.
